qas.question: What is the largest Indo-European ethno-linguistic group in Europe?

answers.text: Slavs are the largest Indo-European ethno-linguistic group in Europe.

qas.question: What areas of the world do Slavs inhabit?

answers.text: They inhabit Central Europe, Eastern Europe, Southeast Europe, North Asia and Central Asia.

qas.question: What was colonised by the East Slavs?

answers.text: The East Slavs colonised Siberia and Central Asia.

qas.question: What portion of Europe's territory is inhabited by Slavic-speaking communities?

answers.text: Presently over half of Europe's territory is inhabited by Slavic-speaking communities
Slavic mercenaries fighting for the Byzantines and Arabs settled Asia Minor and even as far as Syria.

qas.question: What is the largest ethno group in North Asia?
What percentage of Central Asia is inhabited by Slavic-speaking communities?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Slavs<b5_0/> are the largest Indo-European ethno-linguistic group in Europe.<a0_0/> <a1_0>They inhabit Central Europe, Eastern Europe, Southeast Europe, North Asia and Central Asia.<a1_0/> Slavs speak Indo-European Slavic languages and share, to varying degrees, some cultural traits and historical backgrounds. From the early 6th century they spread to inhabit most of Central and Eastern Europe and Southeast Europe, whilst <a4_0><b6_0>Slavic mercenaries<b6_0/> fighting for the Byzantines and Arabs settled Asia Minor and even as far as Syria.<a4_0/> <a2_0>The <b8_0>East Slavs<b8_0/> colonised <b7_0>Siberia and Central Asia<b7_0/>.<a2_0/>[better source needed] <a3_0>Presently <b9_0>over half<b9_0/> of Europe's territory is inhabited by Slavic-speaking communities<a3_0/>, but every Slavic ethnicity has emigrated to other continents.
